intro: Zootrophion fenestratum, commonly known as the fenestrated zootroph, is a rare flowering plant characterized by its unique leaf structure with fenestrations, or leaf holes. It belongs to the family Zootrophionaceae and is native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
